Recap: Reva, Jonathan and Lizzie get invitations to Cassie and Josh's Christmas Party. Tammy has a dream of years later when Sarah is older and She and Jonathan are together. Reva says she is looking forward to Cassie's Party. Ava and Coop plan their future. Reva and Lillian meet up at a meeting. Reva finds out it is a Cancer Survivor Meeting. Reva bumps into a guy at this meeting. Tammy and Cassie talk about the dream Tammy had. Cassie tells Tammy that Jonathan and Lizzie are really trying to make it. Jonathan makes excuses to Lizzie as to why he is taking off. Cassie gives advice to Tammy about getting in the middle of a marriage. As Reva leaves the Cancer Survivor Meeting, Josh shows up. Jeffery and Olivia talk about Jeffery's trashed room. Jonathan runs into Tammy. Buzz and Coop talk about Ava. Reva tells Josh that the party they are at is a Cancer Survivor Meeting. And that Lillian put her up to it. Ashlee and Lizzie get chummy. Jonathan runs into Tammy. Tammy says she didn't come looking for him. Tammy dreams a dream of Jonathan giving her a passionate kiss. Buzz and Olivia hug as Jonathan looks on.
Transcript: Lizzie: Jonathan! Seriously, forget all that. We have a serious emergency.
Reva: It's not an emergency. I would just rather stay at home tonight with the baby.
Lizzie: You can't back out of this. She deserves a night of fun.
Reva: Oh, a single cancer survivors' group. Whoo-hoo! Wild night in Springfield.
Lizzie: It is going to be fun. Tell her it's going to be fun.
Reva: Hey, Lizzie, you're a cancer survivor. Do you want to come?
Lizzie: I'm not single.
Reva: Fine.
Lizzie: We have the house to ourselves tonight.
Jonathan: Yeah. I really want to make sure this thing isn't going to fall on her head. Babies need stimulation, you know.
Lizzie: Yeah, mommies do, too.
Jonathan: Can you hand me the screwdriver over there on the desk?
Lizzie: Hey, you never told me the mail came. Mr. And Mrs. Jonathan Randall. Wow, this is an invitation to Cassie and Josh's holiday party.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Josh: Wow!
Cassie: You like?
Josh: Wow.
Cassie: Really? You don't think it's too...?
Josh: No, I don't think it's not too anything at all. What I'm thinking is that we need to cancel the whole party thing and make a date-- you, me and the dress. The dress, of course, being optional.
Cassie: No, we have already sent out the invitations. We can't just turn back.
Josh: I... I don't want to turn back. I love... I love parties. I think parties are great. And afterward, we're going to head to Telluride, right, with R.J. and Tammy and... can we bring the dress?
Cassie: I already told you, I don't know how to ski.
Josh: Yeah, yeah, that's why they invented ski lodges. (Laughter)
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: Hi, Sarah.
Sarah: Is daddy still up?
Lizzie: Yes, he is but daddy's not paying enough attention to mommy. Go tell him that mommy is upstairs crying and tell him to make mommy happy for your sake, okay? All right, go on. Lots of tears.
Jonathan: Hey, Sarah, baby. What's wrong?
Sarah: (Crying)
Jonathan: It's okay.

Lizzie: I have the most perfect dress for this. I think I actually fit into it again.

Reva: No, it's... it's okay. You guys do, you deserve a night out. Besides, look. See what I got?
Lizzie: They invited her, too.
Jonathan: Did you rsvp with your middle finger or what?
Reva: Actually, I'm looking forward to it. Don't wait up for me. Bye my little sweetie pie. I'm off to be with my people.
Jonathan: They let them out of jail?
Reva: (Laughs)
Lizzie: You heard the lady, we have the night to ourselves. So, do you think together we could think of something to do?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Olivia: You stole that from the inn.

Buzz: A little piece.
Olivia: You know it could have been a more memorable experience.

Olivia: We had to help Harley with the baby. I understand that.
Buzz: Of course you understand, you're a mom.
Olivia: Ooh.
Buzz: I wasn't... I wasn't talking about Ava.
Olivia: You were thinking it?
Buzz: No. You are going to call her?
Olivia: No, I'm not going to call her. She's better off not hearing from me, just so long as Jeffrey stays away from her.
Buzz: Oh, I think he got the message.
Olivia: How do you know.
Buzz: Just a guess. Look I got to go see if Company's still standing, so when I get back, be in that robe.

Olivia: Yes, sir. "Okay, Olivia, I know I've been holding onto this ring for some time now, but I think the time is finally right. Will you marry me?" Okay. (Knock on the door) Hey, I'm glad you came back, I just wanted to...
Jeffrey: Hi. You know, if you wanted me to leave town, you could have just told me yourself.
Olivia: Okay. Leave.

Ava: You are so excited.
Coop: Well, yeah. Aren't you?
Ava: Well, yeah. I mean, living in Europe, and living with you. Are you nervous?
Coop: About the writing program? A little bit, but I think I'm ready for it.
Ava: I know you are.
Coop: Come here.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lillian: Reva.
Reva: Oh, hi. You caught me.
Lillian: Don't tell me you're a afraid?
Reva: Me? No, never.
Lillian: Oh, I'm so glad you came.
Reva: So why would I say no? Really, I mean, such an exclusive guest list, you have to have a fatal disease to get in.
Lillian: No, you have to have survived a fatal disease. We're just going mix and meet a few people. So cheer up.
Reva: What do you talk about, though Lillian? Anything but cancer, right?
Lillian: You can talk about anything you want. That's the beauty of it. I mean, they've all been through it like we have, and all have scars.
Reva: I like guys with scars.
Lillian: Oh, you are so... (laughter)
Reva: Shouldn't I have a sticker or something with my name and my white cell count on it?
Lillian: No. Everybody, this is my friend, Reva.
Reva: Hi.
Lillian: These are all the friends.
Reva: They seem normal.
Lillian: They are normal. You're being bad.
Reva: I know I'm being bad.
Lillian: I'm going to the bar.
Reva: Good idea. Hi. You a regular or are you a first timer?
Cal: No, I'm a regular these days.
Reva: Oh, well that's good. It must be fun then. Have you made friends?
Cal: Well, you know... I'm trying to make friends. And she looks like she would make a great friend, doesn't she?
Reva: A bit young, don't you think?
Cal: Oh, no. Actually, I'm thinking she's a little old. So maybe you should move on. I don't want her to think that I'm taken.

Cassie: It was just a dream, honey. You're okay.
Tammy: It was more than just a dream. Mom, it was more like a premonition.
Cassie: Of what?
Tammy: Of what will happen if Lizzie keeps using Sarah to hold onto Jonathan.
Josh: Listen, you know what? I'm going to head to Towers and deal with some of this party stuff, all right?
Tammy: Oh, you don't have to leave.
Josh: No, no, no, it's okay. I think you and your mom need some alone time. I'll see you in a bit.
Cassie: Thank you.
Tammy: You two make a good team.
Cassie: I never thought I would say this, but so did you and Jonathan. I mean, good enough that you gave up everything so that Lizzie could have her baby.
Tammy: Oh, you don't know how many times I wish I could go back in time, or how many dreams I have about what ifs, or if only's.
Cassie: Honey, Jonathan and Lizzie are married and they are trying to make it work.
Tammy: Yeah, I know. Lizzie already accused me of trying to be a home wrecker. I don't want to be that. I never thought I could be the kind of girl that took a husband away from his wife and child.
Cassie: But...
Tammy: But what if Jonathan's not happy, you know? I mean, what really happens to a child if her parents don't even love each other?
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: That looks great.
Jonathan: Hmmm. Sarah's a little cranky. I was thinking of throwing her in the car, taking her for a ride, or maybe bring her down and show her the Christmas lights on Main Street.
Lizzie: It's too cold outside. Besides listen. What do you hear?
Jonathan: Nothing.
Lizzie: Exactly. Sarah's already sleeping. I guess she knew that her mommy and daddy needed to unwind.
Jonathan: We should really work on the nursery.
Lizzie: That can wait.
Jonathan: But it's so hard to get stuff done when... when she's awake, you know? And... the home improvement store is open late, actually.
Lizzie: Jonathan, is it that hard to be alone with me?
Jonathan: I want to be a good husband, not just a good father, you know? But it's not something you can force.
Lizzie: Is that what I'm doing, forcing you?
Jonathan: No, no. It's... I mean, nobody's going anywhere. We have time to get to figure each other out.
Lizzie: It doesn't take that much to figure me out.
Jonathan: Well, I'm pretty simple, too. But one thing you need to know about super dad right now is that he needs to go get supplies. I'll be right back, beautiful. Okay? Okay.
Lizzie: You get "beautiful," and I get a kiss on my forehead.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cassie: Chamomile or orange blossom?
Tammy: I told you I don't want any.
Cassie: Honey, look, I am the last person to tell you not to get in the middle of someone's marriage, but I'm hoping you can learn from my mistakes.
Tammy: Are you saying that you and Josh are a mistake?
Cassie: No, absolutely not. I'm saying I never tried to get Josh to choose between me and Reva. I tried to trust that if we belonged together, we would be together. And that's what happened.
Tammy: So shut my mouth and don't do anything?
Cassie: No, I'm just saying that whatever you do, go easy. And trust that when the time comes, you'll know what to do.
Tammy: Uh-huh. Mom, this is Lizzie. There is no such thing as trust.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Cal: See, I'm out of practice. See, before I was sick, that kind of woman would have been no sweat.
Reva: Yeah, the cancer zapped your mojo. That's a good story.
Cal: A word of advice, when you are coming on to a man, you don't want to make fun of them.
Reva: Oh, no, I'm not coming on to you.
Cal: Oh, if you say so.
Reva: I just felt sorry for you for being smacked down by goldilocks.
Cal: You're just enjoying this a little too much.
Reva: Yes I am!
Cal: I'm Cal.
Reva: Reva. Good luck with the coat check girl. I understand she just got her braces off.
Cal: I'm guessing Hodgkin's? Me, I'm melanoma man.

Reva: I just bet you are. No, I'm breast cancer survivor, and I still have both of them. You lose. Lillian, I'm going to take off. I came here looking for something that I'm really not ready to get into just yet. So take care.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Olivia: I could have the bellman meet you in your room and help you pack.

Olivia: Buzz? What are you talking about? We were out of town.
Jeffrey: Well, before you left town, ol' Buzzy boy decided he wanted to break into my room and throw all of my belongings out into the hallway.
Olivia: Buzz? My buzz?
Jeffrey: Your Buzz. Here, he even left me a note.
Olivia: "Just trying to help you along with your life."
Jeffrey: Some guy, huh?

Tammy: I bet you could use an extra pair of hands.

Tom Pelphrey, "Inside The Light." The best day I ever had on the set was... must have been... ah... ah... the best day I ever had on the set was today, because each day is better than the last because we always learn something new. See Jonathan, Wednesday, December 20, "Inside The Light"

Olivia: Settle down? Who told you?
Jeffrey: Who told me what?
Olivia: Who told you that Buzz wants to marry me?
Jeffrey: Well, I don't see a ring on your finger, so I guess your little romantic getaway didn't go so well did it?
Olivia: Because of you.
Jeffrey: Because of me. Of course, you can blame everything in your life now on me.
Olivia: Everything that has gone wrong in my life can be traced back to you, Jeffrey.
Jeffrey: Well, if that makes you feel better, then go ahead and blame away. But your love life was a train wreck long before now.
Olivia: Why is that? Maybe because the first time I ever spent with a man was a nightmare I still haven't woken up from.
Jeffrey: I have apologized in more ways than I know how. Okay, you know what? If you want my head on a platter, let's go ahead and do it.
Olivia: Do what?

Jeffrey: Let's go to San Cristobel. Okay, I'll turn myself in to the cops. Okay, I'll turn myself in and I'll tell them how I took advantage of a poor, innocent little girl that night all those years ago, and how her life now has been a tragedy ever since. Would that make you feel better?
Olivia: Yes. You're buying plane tickets. When do we go?

Alan-Michael: No, I heard what you said. I just don't understand what the problem is.
Coop: We have to find a place that we can live--

Ava: Okay, this is just going to take a minute.

Reva: Oh, of course. Yeah, the holiday party.

Reva: Josh.
Josh: Yeah.

Reva: Thank you.

Tammy: So you're out on a late-night stuffed animal run?

Tammy: Okay. I'll see you around.

Jonathan: You mean like fate?
Tammy: I don't know. I don't know, but maybe my mom's right. Maybe I need to learn to trust and just let things happen.
Jonathan: I'm not going to pretend to understand what you're talking about.
Tammy: There's something that you need to know. You've been trying so hard to make this family with Lizzie. And I've kept my distance because I respected that.
Jonathan: I know you do.
Tammy: I heard Lizzie the other day...
Jonathan: I have a feeling I know what this is about.
Tammy: You do?
Jonathan: Yeah, Lizzie's upset. She thinks I'm too focused on Sarah.
Tammy: Well, I'm sure she wants you to love your baby...
Jonathan: No, she is right. I admit it. It's weird. I never expected to... I'll be looking at her, and all of a sudden, a half an hour has gone by and I realize I was in some kind of trance.
Tammy: Well, you love her.
Jonathan: Yeah, but me with a baby?
Tammy: I never doubted that you would love your baby, but when it comes to Lizzie...
Jonathan: I know. I'm just not there. I know. I can feel this neediness coming off her like heat. But I'm just not there. I mean, well, if I could be a good dad, maybe I can be a good husband.
Tammy: Those are two completely different things.
Jonathan: And I have you to thank for it.
Tammy: What?
Jonathan: Everything that I am now and everything that I hope to be, I have you to thank for it.
Tammy: Me?
Jonathan: Yeah. Sometimes when I think about Sarah, and how I'm afraid that I'll blow it or ruin her life, I think about the guy that you made me want to be.
Tammy: Jonathan, you are never going to be good for Sarah until you open your eyes and realize that Lizzie is using her to hold onto her.
Jonathan: She loves Sarah.
Tammy: No. If you want to do right by Sarah, you will take her and you'll leave Lizzie and you'll start a family with me, that family that we've always wanted.
Jonathan: You don't know how long I've been waiting for you to say that. I can't even imagine how hard it's been for you to deal with all this. I know that you want Sarah to be happy, too.
Tammy: I do.
Jonathan: Tammy?
Tammy: Yeah?
Jonathan: You look like you wanted to say something.
Tammy: No.
Jonathan: You sure?
Tammy: You've said everything there really is to say. So, you know, don't let me keep you from your family.
Jonathan: I'll see you at Josh and Cassie's Christmas party?
Tammy: Sure, maybe, I don't know.
Jonathan: Okay. See ya.

Ashlee: So snap out of it. When is it that you started to roll over like a puppy for anyone?
Lizzie: I don't.
Ashlee: Yeah, that's my point. You want Jonathan, you take him. You're Lizzie Spaulding.

Lizzie: No, you're not. Okay, so what, that Tammy is still in the picture? And so what that every bit of Jonathan's attention goes to Sarah? That could change.

Lizzie: I was going to say a babysitter, but that, too. This party... this party is a platinum opportunity for me.
Ashlee: Yeah, platinum.

Ashlee: You work it, mama.
Lizzie: Okay, hair, nails, fragrance-- Jonathan will have to be dead to not notice me.
Ashlee: Yeah, right. Oh, but what if Tammy's there?

Reva: So what are you doing tomorrow night?
Cal: Ah, well, you know, holidays, so many parties, so little time.
Reva: Nothing, huh?
Cal: No, no, I didn't say that.
Reva: You didn't have to.
Cal: You should have seen me before I got sick.
Reva: Yeah, yeah, I know, me, too. I had them in the palm of my hand, Calvin. You would have been putty.
Cal: Cal is short for Caleb.
Reva: It is? I like Calvin. Come on, I have to go to this party. I want you to come with me.
Cal: Who's going to be on whose arm, me or you... arm?
Reva: What does it matter? You're not doing anything anyway, right? So just come, it will give you an opportunity to meet healthy, age-appropriate women for a change.
Cal: Are there going to be any women like you there?
Reva: Just me. Deal?
Cal: Deal.
Reva: Gotcha. High-five on that. (Laughs)

Coop: I was just thinking that my writing program, it doesn't start for another couple of weeks, but why wait? You know? Why don't we just go over there? How fair would it be to you if we go over and immediately I have to start working?
Ava: That's okay. I don't care if I have a job. That's fine.
Coop: No, look, that's fine. We'll go over, we'll get settled and we will get you a job. We'll take care of all of that.
Ava: You mean leave right now?
Coop: Yeah.
Ava: No.
Coop: Why not? We can go over and start our new life.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Olivia: Hey.
Buzz: Hey. What was that for?
Olivia: For being my enforcer. I heard about the message you sent to Jeffrey.
Buzz: Well, it didn't work, though. He's still here.

Olivia: It worked for me. Worked for me. It was the gesture that counts. Besides, his real punishment is seeing me happy with you and seeing that Ava has no room in her life for him. Come on, let that guy live knowing that everyone he hurt is happy in spite of him.
Buzz: Yeah.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Ashlee: Hey, Tammy.
Tammy: Ashlee, hey, what's up?
Ashlee: Nothing. Oh, I can't wait for your mom and Josh's party.
Tammy: Yeah, I don't know if I'm going.
Ashlee: Really? I can't blame you. Jonathan and Lizzie will be there with the baby, and who can compete with that?
Tammy: I guess.
Ashlee: You don't have to pretend with me, I understand. Lizzie has everything. She has the best man, the baby, and the wedding ring. Maybe you should just quit while you're ahead.
Santa: Ho, ho, ho, have you been naughty or nice this year, young lady?
Tammy: Way, way too nice.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Lizzie: Poor guy doesn't stand a chance.
[SCENE_BREAK]
Next, on "Guiding Light"...
Harley: Is Reva coming?
Cassie: Yeah, sure, of course.
Cal: Well, she seems nice, for the woman who stole your husband.
Lizzie: You're a guy, you have needs. You know it can be like that again.
